text: Frank Charles Carlucci III (October 18, 1930 - June 3, 2018) was an American politician. He served as the United States Secretary of Defense from 1987 to 1989 in the administration of President Ronald Reagan.SecDef stories - Frank C. Carlucci, Department of Defense Carlucci served in a variety of senior- level governmental positions, including Director of the Office of Economic Opportunity in the Richard Nixon administration, Deputy Director of the CIA in the Jimmy Carter administration, and Deputy Secretary of Defense and National Security Advisor in the Reagan administration. Carlucci died on June 3, 2018, from complications of Parkinson's disease, at his home in McLean, Virginia, at the age of 87. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from Parkinson's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in Virginia Category:United States Secretaries of Defense Category:United States National Security Advisors Category:Ambassadors of the United States Category:Politicians from Scranton, Pennsylvania Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
